item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: wordpress
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Our Mission
item.dc:creator: wordpress
item.content:encoded:
The internet is amazing. It’s essential to growing the knowledge that we have and share with each other. And for many of us, it's a huge part of our everyday lives. But something is missing, something huge—over half of the world is still unconnected. Until everyone has access, we will all be incomplete.
Our goal is to provide everyone in the world with access to the internet, for free.
Imagine the difference an accurate weather report makes for a farmer planting crops. Think about the power of putting an encyclopedia into the hands of a child who doesn't even have a textbook. Now, imagine what they might be able to contribute when the world can hear their voices. We’re not doing this to make the internet better. We're doing this to connect us all. Because the more we connect, the better it gets.

item.title: Our Approach
item.dc:creator: wordpress
item.content:encoded:
To share the internet's knowledge and inspiration with the world, Internet.org is overcoming issues of accessibility, affordability and awareness—in hopes that one day, everyone will be connected.

Free Basics by Facebook

In over 17 countries, people can now access a set of basic services for free—like news, job postings, health information, and communication tools like Facebook. [io-custom-link css_class="link" source="20" link_to_press="panel" image="164" link_title="Free Basics from Internet.org" link_text="Learn More"]

Mobile Operator Partnerships

We’re providing local Mobile Operators with a program that is sustainable and easy to deploy anywhere in the world. [io-custom-link css_class="link" source="26" link_to_press="panel" image="164" link_text="Learn More"]

Developer Platform

Internet.org is an open platform for developers worldwide to create services that meet local needs, everywhere. [io-custom-link css_class="link" source="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/internet-org" link_text="Learn More"]

Aquila Unmanned Aircraft

With the wingspan of a 737 and weighing less than a small car, Aquila will beam internet to even the most remote areas on earth. [io-custom-link source="21" link_to_press="panel" image="166" link_text="Learn More"]

Innovation Labs

Our global testing environment helps people build high quality apps that perform well on any network in the world. [io-custom-link source="23" link_to_press="panel" image="167" link_text="Learn More"]

Innovation Challenge

We’re donating over $500,000 to help developers create services that advance the lives of students, women, farmers, and agricultural workers. [io-custom-link source="24" link_to_press="panel" image="167" link_text="Learn More"]

item.title: Our Impact
item.dc:creator: wordpress
item.content:encoded:
Over 200,000 new people experience the value of internet access every week. 17 countries can now access Internet.org's free basic services, and they're taking the initiative—using this information to improve their lives. They're doing better in school, building new businesses, and learning how to stay healthy.

Kenner

[io_video id="150"] Kenner and his classmates are using Internet.org to do homework.

Jesus

[io_video id="152"] Internet access turned Jesus’ passion for drawing into a job.

Paula

[io_video id="153"] Paula used the internet to turn her home business into a better life for her family.

Juan David

[io_video id="155"] Juan David used Internet.org to find a market for his lemon juice.

Marissa

[io_video id="157"] Marissa is using internet.org to start her boutique.

Riza

[io_video id="158"] Riza used internet.org to write her computer science thesis.

Efren

[io_video id="159"] Efren uses internet.org to discover the beauty of math.

Renald

[io_video id="160"] Renald uses internet.org to keep in touch with his sister.

Renald

[io_video id="160"] Renald finds a literary escape on internet.org

Elisha

[io_video id="161"] Elisha uses internet.org to become a better father.

Elisha

[io_video id="161"] With weather data from the internet, Elisha is improving his tea yield.
